intro: Solanum costatum, commonly known as the roughleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central America. It features elongated, ovate leaves with a rough, serrated texture and a hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet, typically blooming in summer. Its berries are initially green and turn red when mature, containing toxic alkaloids. Solanum costatum is often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
